title: Lorry transporting chickens hits wild elephant: driver injured, birds dead
byline: A lorry transporting chickens to be slaughtered bumped into a wild elephant crossing the road at the Rideeella Forest Reserve on the Dambulla–Bakamuna highway.

title: 31 dead, including women and children, in stampede at Vijay’s rally in Tamil Nadu
byline: Thirty-one people, including women and children, are feared dead after a stampede broke out during Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) chief Vijay’s campaign rally in Tamil Nadu’s Karur on Saturday. The incident forced the actor-turned-politician to temporarily pause his speech as several attendees fainted amid severe overcrowding.

title: President arrives in Japan
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake arrived at Kansai International Airport in Osaka this morning (27), commencing his official visit to Japan at the invitation of the Japanese government.

title: Divorce rate drives rise in women-headed households
byline: An academic has revealed that as many as 1.2 million families in Sri Lanka are headed by women, with the number steadily increasing due to the country’s high divorce rate.

title: Modernization project launched at Narahenpita Railway station
byline: The project to modernize the Narahenpita Railway Station was officially launched today (27) under the “Dream Destination” program, implemented as part of the “Clean Sri Lanka” initiative.

title: Pakistan ‘won the war’ against India, PM Sharif tells UNGA
byline: Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Friday, highlighting the human rights violations in Kashmir and Palestine and condemning terrorism, reiterated Pakistan’s commitment to peace and dialogue but vowed to resolutely defend the nation against any external aggression or India’s usurpation of water rights.

title: UK government to guarantee £1.5bn JLR loan after cyber shutdown
byline: The government will underwrite a £1.5bn loan guarantee to Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) in a bid to support its suppliers as a cyber attack continues to halt production at the car maker.

title: Boy killed by express train in Rambukkana
byline: A 14-year-old boy died after being struck by an express train travelling from Badulla to Colombo Fort at the Tismalpola railway station in the Rambukkana police division.

title: Another monk succumbs to injuries after Melsiripura truck collapse
byline: Another monk receiving treatment at the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) of the Kurunegala Base Hospital has passed away following the tragic collapse of a cable truck at the Na Uyana Aranya Senasana in Melsiripura.

title: Channa Jayasumana urges President to suspend LGBTIQ tourism project
byline: Former Health Minister and medical professional Dr. Channa Jayasumana has written to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, urging him to immediately suspend a Sri Lanka Tourism initiative promoting LGBTIQ tourism.

title: Piece of finger skin found in sliced bread at Hatton bakery
byline: A shocking incident was reported in Hatton when a customer had discovered a piece of human skin from a finger wound inside a sliced loaf of bread purchased from a local bakery.

title: Two suspects arrested over Rs. 6 million gold robbery in Ganemulla
byline: Two suspects have been arrested in connection with the assault and robbery of gold ornaments worth nearly Rs. 6 million, police said.

title: Iran recalls envoys to UK, France, Germany as UN sanctions reimposed
byline: Iran has recalled its envoys to the United Kingdom, France and Germany for consultations, according to state media, after the three European countries triggered a mechanism reinstating the United Nations’ sanctions on the Islamic Republic for the first time in a decade.
